H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H5349.def: = a person whose profession it is to keep sheep for the purpose of having them produce high quality offspring

H2372.def: = process by which someone perceives an important object with the eyes, or witnesses an event of some significance

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H5818.def: = man, also known as {L:Azariah<SDBH:עֲזַרְיָה>}; ◄ son of {L:Amaziah<SDBH:אֲמַצְיָהוּ>}; tribe of Judah; ► father of {L:Jotham<SDBH:יֹותָם>}; king of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}, but became leprous after he burned incense in the temple

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H3063.def: = man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Leah<SDBH:לֵאָה>}; ► founder of one of the tribes of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}, which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of {L:Solomon<SDBH:שְׁלֹמֹה>}, and, after the exile, a separate administrative district

H3379.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Nebath<SDBH:נְבָט>}; ► former servant of {L:Solomon<SDBH:שְׁלֹמֹה>} who later became the first king of the northern kingdom of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}

H3101.def: = man; ◄ tribe of {L:Manasseh<SDBH:מְנַשֶּׁה>}; ► father of {L:Gideon<SDBH:גִּדְעֹון>}, judge of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}

141.dom: Names of People|Names of Groups|Names of Locations

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H7580.def: = action by which animals, humans, or deities produce a full, deep, prolonged sound as made by a lion; ≈ associated with aggression, but also with suffering

H6726.def: = mountain; ► that part of {L:Jerusalem<SDBH:יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם>} on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, YHWH's dwelling place

H3389.def: = town, formerly referred to as {L:Salem<SDBH:שָׁלֵם>} and {L:Jebus<SDBH:יְבוּס>};◄ located on Mt. {L:Zion<SDBH:צִיֹּון>}; territory of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}; ► conquered by king {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, who made it the capital of his kingdom

H4999.def: = a location that deities, humans or animals have made their dwelling place

H7462.def: = action by which animals are feeding on grass and other edible materials in the field, ≈ often extended to denote the way a king cares for his subjects or the way God cares for his people

H56.def: = to experience grief and show this by one's actions; ◄ caused by bereavement, loss, or other difficult circumstances

H7218.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H3760.def: = newly ripened grain which has just been harvested and which has not yet been dried for storage or for grinding into flour

H3001.def: = process by which objects containing liquid essential to their existence lose these liquids ◄ due to some external or internal cause

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H7969.def: = state in which a countable entity is three in number

H6588.def: = action by which humans or groups defy an authority or a standard of behavior; by extension, can also refer to the punishment or guilt incurred from a trangression

H1834.def: = town; ◄ in {L:Syria<SDBH:אֲרָם>}; ► capital of one of the {L:Aramaean<SDBH:אֲרָם>} kingdoms

H702.def: = state in which a countable entity is four in number

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H1758.def: = causative action by which humans separate grain from straw by having animals trample it or by dragging a threshing board over it; ≈ often used figuratively to denote acts of aggression

H1568.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Makir<SDBH:מָכִיר>}; tribe of {L:Manasseh<SDBH:מְנַשֶּׁה>}; ► settler of the area on the east side of the {L:Jordan<SDBH:יַרְדֵּן>}

H1270.def: = a strong, hard magnetic silvery-grey metal, ► used in construction and manufacturing; ≈ associated with strength and permanence

H7971.def: = causative action by which humans or deities commission one or more agents to go to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task

H784.def: = state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
